Waltham.Hager\u2013Mead House: The Hager–Mead House is a historic house at 411 Main Street in Waltham, Massachusetts. The ​2 1⁄2-story wood-frame house was built in 1795, and is one of the city's small number of 18th-century houses. It is five bays wide and two deep, with chimneys set in the ridge, and a center entry flanked by Doric pilasters and topped by a six-pane transom window and modillioned cornice.
